rationale: The task requested fixing the `randomIntBetween(2, 9)` call to account for inclusive upper bounds by changing 9 to 8. The ground truth makes this simple one-line change. The agent's solution overcomplicates this by: (1) introducing `Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors()` logic that was never requested or necessary, (2) adding a JUnit `Assume` import and assumption check that creates unnecessary test skipping behavior, and (3) calculating `maxThreadCount` dynamically when the fix only required changing a constant. This violates the 'avoid over-engineering' principle - the agent added features and complexity beyond what was asked. The core fix (using 8 instead of 9) is technically present but buried in unnecessary logic. The solution is less maintainable, harder to understand, and introduces processor-dependent behavior that could cause tests to skip on single-core systems - behavior that was never part of the original test design.
